00062 //
00063 // vec2 - template class for 2-tuple vector
00064 //
00066 template <class T>   
00067 class vec2 {
00068 public:
00069 
00070     typedef T value_type;
00071     int size() const { return 2;}
00072 
00074     //
00075     //  Constructors
00076     //
00078 
00079     // Default/scalar constructor
00080     vec2(const T & t = T()) {
00081         for(int i = 0; i < size(); i++) _array[i] = t;
00082     }
00083 
00084     // Construct from array
00085     vec2(const T * tp) {
00086         for(int i = 0; i < size(); i++) _array[i] = tp[i];
00087     }
00088 
00089     // Construct from explicit values
00090     vec2( const T v0, const T v1) {
00091         x = v0;
00092         y = v1;
00093     }
00094 
00095     explicit vec2( const vec3<T> &u) {
00096         for(int i = 0; i < size(); i++) _array[i] = u._array[i];
00097     }
00098 
00099     explicit vec2( const vec4<T> &u) {
00100         for(int i = 0; i < size(); i++) _array[i] = u._array[i];
00101     }
00102     
00103     const T * get_value() const {
00104         return _array;
00105     }
00106     
00107     vec2<T> & set_value( const T * rhs ) {
00108         for(int i = 0; i < size(); i++) _array[i] = rhs[i];
00109         return *this;
00110     }
00111     
00112     // indexing operators
00113     T & operator [] ( int i ) {
00114         return _array[i];
00115     }
00116     
00117     const T & operator [] ( int i ) const {
00118         return _array[i];
00119     }
00120 
00121     // type-cast operators
00122     operator T * () {
00123         return _array;
00124     }
00125 
00126     operator const T * () const {
00127         return _array;
00128     }
00129 
00131     //
00132     //  Math operators
00133     //
00135 
00136     // scalar multiply assign
00137     friend vec2<T> & operator *= ( vec2<T> &lhs, T d ) {
00138         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] *= d;
00139         return lhs;
00140     }
00141 
00142     // component-wise vector multiply assign
00143     friend vec2<T> & operator *= ( vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> &rhs ) {
00144         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] *= rhs[i];
00145         return lhs;
00146     }
00147 
00148     // scalar divide assign
00149     friend vec2<T> & operator /= ( vec2<T> &lhs, T d ) {
00150         if(d == 0) return lhs;
00151         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] /= d;
00152         return lhs;
00153     }
00154 
00155     // component-wise vector divide assign
00156     friend vec2<T> & operator /= ( vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs ) {
00157         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] /= rhs._array[i];
00158         return lhs;
00159     }
00160 
00161     // component-wise vector add assign
00162     friend vec2<T> & operator += ( vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs ) {
00163         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] += rhs._array[i];
00164         return lhs;
00165     }
00166 
00167     // component-wise vector subtract assign
00168     friend vec2<T> & operator -= ( vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs ) {
00169         for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) lhs._array[i] -= rhs._array[i];
00170         return lhs;
00171     }
00172 
00173     // unary negate
00174     friend vec2<T> operator - ( const vec2<T> &rhs) {
00175         vec2<T> rv;
00176         for(int i = 0; i < rhs.size(); i++) rv._array[i] = -rhs._array[i];
00177         return rv;
00178     }
00179 
00180     // vector add
00181     friend vec2<T> operator + ( const vec2<T> & lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs) {
00182         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00183         return rt += rhs;
00184     }
00185 
00186     // vector subtract 
00187     friend vec2<T> operator - ( const vec2<T> & lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs) {
00188         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00189         return rt -= rhs;
00190     }
00191 
00192     // scalar multiply
00193     friend vec2<T> operator * ( const vec2<T> & lhs, T rhs) {
00194         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00195         return rt *= rhs;
00196     }
00197 
00198     // scalar multiply
00199     friend vec2<T> operator * ( T lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs) {
00200         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00201         return rt *= rhs;
00202     }
00203 
00204     // vector component-wise multiply
00205     friend vec2<T> operator * ( const vec2<T> & lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs){
00206         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00207         return rt *= rhs;
00208     }
00209 
00210     // scalar multiply
00211     friend vec2<T> operator / ( const vec2<T> & lhs, T rhs) {
00212         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00213         return rt /= rhs;
00214     }
00215 
00216     // vector component-wise multiply
00217     friend vec2<T> operator / ( const vec2<T> & lhs, const vec2<T> & rhs){
00218         vec2<T> rt(lhs);
00219         return rt /= rhs;
00220     }
00221 
00223     //
00224     //  Comparison operators
00225     //
00227 
00228     // equality
00229     friend bool operator == ( const vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> &rhs ) {
00230         bool r = true;
00231         for (int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++)
00232             r &= lhs._array[i] == rhs._array[i];
00233         return r;
00234     }
00235 
00236     // inequality
00237     friend bool operator != ( const vec2<T> &lhs, const vec2<T> &rhs ) {
00238         bool r = true;
00239         for (int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++)
00240             r &= lhs._array[i] != rhs._array[i];
00241         return r;
00242     }
00243    
00244     //data intentionally left public to allow vec2.x
00245     union {
00246         struct {
00247             T x,y;          // standard names for components
00248         };
00249         struct {
00250             T s,t;          // standard names for components
00251         };
00252         T _array[2];     // array access
00253     };
00254 };

00428         bool r = true;

00436         bool r = true;

00438             r &= lhs._array[i] != rhs._array[i];
00439         return r;
00440     }
00441 
00443     //
00444     // dimension specific operations
00445     //
00447 
00448     // cross product
00449     friend vec3<T> cross( const vec3<T> & lhs, const vec3<T> & rhs) {
00450         vec3<T> r;
00451 
00452         r.x = lhs.y * rhs.z - lhs.z * rhs.y;
00453         r.y = lhs.z * rhs.x - lhs.x * rhs.z;
00454         r.z = lhs.x * rhs.y - lhs.y * rhs.x;
00455 
00456         return r;
00457     }

00461         struct {
00462             T x, y, z;          // standard names for components
00463         };
00464         struct {
00465             T s, t, r;          // standard names for components
00466         };
00467         T _array[3];     // array access
00468     };
00469 };

00477 class vec4 {
00478 public:

00492     }
00493 
00494     // Construct from array
00495     vec4(const T * tp) {
00496         for(int i = 0; i < 4; i++) _array[i] = tp[i];
00497     }
00498 
00499     // Construct from explicit values
00500     vec4( const T v0, const T v1, const T v2, const T v3) {
00501         x = v0;
00502         y = v1;
00503         z = v2;
00504         w = v3;
00505     }
00506

00508         x = u.x;
00509         y = u.y;
00510         z = u.z;

00512     }

00515         x = u.x;
00516         y = u.y;
00517         z = v0;
00518         w = v1;
00519     }

00522         return _array;

00527         return *this;
00528     }

00536         return _array[i];
00537     }

00662     //data intentionally left public to allow vec2.x
00663     union {
00664         struct {
00665             T x, y, z, w;          // standard names for components
00666         };
00667         struct {
00668             T s, t, r, q;          // standard names for components

00670         T _array[4];     // array access

00673 
00675 //
00676 // Generic vector operations
00677 //
00679 
00680 // compute the dot product of two vectors
00681 template<class T>
00682 inline typename T::value_type dot( const T & lhs, const T & rhs ) { 
00683     typename T::value_type r = 0;
00684     for(int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) r += lhs._array[i] * rhs._array[i];
00685     return r;
00686 }
00687 
00688 // return the length of the provided vector
00689 template< class T>
00690 inline T length( const T & vec) {
00691     T r = 0;
00692     for(int i = 0; i < vec.size(); i++) r += vec._array[i]*vec._array[i]; 
00693     return T::value_type(sqrt(r));
00694 }
00695 
00696 // return the squared norm
00697 template< class T>
00698 inline T square_norm( const T & vec) {
00699     T r = 0;
00700     for(int i = 0; i < vec.size(); i++) r += vec._array[i]*vec._array[i]; 
00701     return r;
00702 }
00703 
00704 // return the normalized version of the vector
00705 template< class T>
00706 inline T normalize( const T & vec) { 
00707     typename T::value_type sum(0);
00708     T r;
00709     for(int i = 0; i < vec.size(); i++) 
00710         sum += vec._array[i] * vec._array[i];
00711     sum = typename T::value_type(sqrt(sum));
00712     if (sum > 0)
00713         for(int i = 0; i < vec.size(); i++) 
00714             r._array[i] = vec._array[i] / sum;
00715     return r;
00716 }
00717 
00718 // In VC8 : min and max are already defined by a #define...
00719 #ifdef min
00720 #undef min
00721 #endif
00722 #ifdef max
00723 #undef max
00724 #endif
00725 //componentwise min
00726 template< class T>
00727 inline T min( const T & lhs, const T & rhs ) {
00728     T rt;
00729     for (int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) rt._array[i] = std::min( lhs._array[i], rhs._array[i]);
00730     return rt;
00731 }
00732 
00733 // componentwise max
00734 template< class T>
00735 inline T max( const T & lhs, const T & rhs ) {
00736     T rt;
00737     for (int i = 0; i < lhs.size(); i++) rt._array[i] = std::max( lhs._array[i], rhs._array[i]);
00738     return rt;
00739 }
00740 
00741 
00742 };
00743 
00744 #endif
